Exact Match: Entire response must match exactly
Partial Match: A relative part of the score will be given for each correct response area
Partial Match per response: Cumulative Score value will be given for each correct response area
scoring_type.name: Scoring type

options.label: Partial match per cell - max score

value.description: A 3 dimensional array that consists of: An array of different valid responses (in most cases there will only be one valid response), each valid response is an array that contains an entry for each cell. each cell is an array of response index's. The response index is based on the index value in the possible_responses attribute.
value.name: Value

valid_response.description: An object containing the valid response score and value.
valid_response.name: Valid response

alt_responses.description: An array of alternate response objects used for giving a supplementary value if the question was not valid
alt_responses.name: Alternate responses

rounding.name: Rounding
rounding.description: Method for rounding the score after it has been calculated as a fraction of score. none: No rounding applied, floor: Rounded down to the nearest whole number.

validation.description: Validation object that includes options on how this question will be automarked

description.name: Description (deprecated)

duplicate_responses.description: When true the items from the possible_responses will be reusable infinite times.
duplicate_responses.name: Duplicate responses

possibility_list_position.description: Defines where the possibility list sits relative to the input zone.
possibility_list_position.name: Possibility List Position

fontsize.description: Controls the size of base font for this question. Options are among 'small', 'normal', 'large', 'xlarge' and 'xxlarge'.
fontsize.name: Font size

show_drag_handle.description: Determines whether to show the drag handle.
show_drag_handle.name: Show drag handle

ui_style.description: Object used to control different aspects of the UI
ui_style.name: UI Style - DRAFT

Allows specifying the audio format instead of relying on the file extension on src.
If format is not defined and src does not have a file extension, the format is assumed to be "mp3".
